intro: Pentacme malayana, commonly known as the Malay pentacme, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. It is often found in lowland and hill areas, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
